titleStmt.title: William Stewart, Jr. and Nancy A. Stewart to James F. Robinson
CWG8630

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his Excellency,, Jas F, Robinson Esqr,
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

We, William Stewart and wife, Nancy A. Stewart,, citizens of Trigg Co. Ky. would beg leave to represent to your Excellency that at the Feby, Term 1861 of the Trigg Circuit Court, a Judgment was rendered agst, said Wm Stewart and in favor of the Commonwealth of Ky. for the sum of one hundred Dollars, upon an indictment found agst, him for an assault and battery upon his wife the said Nancy A. Stewart. We would further state, that at the time said Judgment was rendered, we were living together in peace & harmony, and have been ever since and are at this time, That we are in humble circumstances and have a large family of children to support.

We would therefore respectfully ask your Excellency to remit said fine, as it would greatly benefit us and our children, and do no injustice, we hope to the Commonwealth, And as in duty bound we will ever pray &c,

William Stewart Jr
Nancy A Stewart
William Stewart and Nancy A. Stewart say that the foregoing statement of facts is true.
Sworn to & subscribed before me this 16 day of January 1863
The undersigned citizens believing the above facts to be true would respectfully solicit your Excellencys interposition and remission of the fine

Jos McAllister
Jno R Grace
M Mayes
R D Baker

Trigg Cir. Ct
Will Steward of Trigg
Pettn to remit fine
Fine remitted
$100 } Assault
Believing that the parties in this case are in harmony & peace & being nothing disposes as far as proper to keep them so -- the fine in the pettn named is remitted
